        builders in class AVOptions

      • benchmark

        public AVAdvancedOptions benchmark()
        ‘-benchmark (global)’ Show benchmarking information at the end of an encode. Shows CPU time used and maximum memory consumption. Maximum memory consumption is not supported on all systems, it will usually display as 0 if not supported.

      • timeLimit

        public AVAdvancedOptions timeLimit(Long limit)
        ‘-timelimit duration (global)’ Exit after avconv has been running for duration seconds.

      • dump

        public AVAdvancedOptions dump()
        ‘-dump (global)’ Dump each input packet to stderr.

      • hex

        public AVAdvancedOptions hex()
        ‘-hex (global)’ When dumping packets, also dump the payload.

      • videoSyncMethod

        public AVAdvancedOptions videoSyncMethod(AVVideoSyncType videoSyncType)
        ‘-vsync parameter’ Video sync method.

      • videoSyncMethod

        public AVAdvancedOptions videoSyncMethod(String videoSyncTypeName)

      • copyTimestamps

        public AVAdvancedOptions copyTimestamps()
        ‘-copyts’ Copy timestamps from input to output.

      • copyTimeBase

        public AVAdvancedOptions copyTimeBase()
        ‘-copytb’ Copy input stream time base from input to output when stream copying.

      • discontinuityDeltaThreshold

        public AVAdvancedOptions discontinuityDeltaThreshold()
        ‘-dts_delta_threshold’ Timestamp discontinuity delta threshold.

      • filterComplexScript

        public AVAdvancedOptions filterComplexScript(String fileName)
        ‘-filter_complex_script filename (global)’ This option is similar to ‘-filter_complex’, the only difference is that its argument is the name of the file from which a complex filtergraph description is to be read.

      • shortest

        public AVAdvancedOptions shortest()
        ‘-shortest (output)’ Finish encoding when the shortest input stream ends.

      • maxDemuxDelay

        public AVAdvancedOptions maxDemuxDelay(Long seconds)
        ‘-muxdelay seconds (input)’ Set the maximum demux-decode delay.

      • demuxPreLoadDelay

        public AVAdvancedOptions demuxPreLoadDelay(Long seconds)
        ‘-muxpreload seconds (input)’ Set the initial demux-decode delay.

      • accurateSeek

        public AVAdvancedOptions accurateSeek(boolean accurate)
        ‘-accurate_seek (input)’ This option enables or disables accurate seeking in input files with the ‘-ss’ option. It is enabled by default, so seeking is accurate when transcoding. Use ‘-noaccurate_seek’ to disable it, which may be useful e.g. when copying some streams and transcoding the others.
